text: Burundi is competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Burundi has entered four swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Belly-Crésus Ganira |align=left|50 m freestyle |25.33 |99 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m butterfly |1:03.34 |76 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Billy-Scott Irakoze |align=left|100 m freestyle |56.45 |104 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|50 m butterfly |28.43 |76 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font- size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Odrina Kaze |align=left|50 m freestyle |34.97 |98 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|50 m breaststroke |49.77 |56 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Burundi at the World Aquatics Championships World Aquatics Championships
title: Burundi at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
